com.brightcove.drm.widevine

Class CheckRightsStatusTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.os.AsyncTask<Source,java.lang.Void,java.lang.Integer>
      • com.brightcove.drm.widevine.CheckRightsStatusTask

  • public class CheckRightsStatusTask
extends android.os.AsyncTask<Source,java.lang.Void,java.lang.Integer>
    This class checks whether the given rights-protected Source has valid rights for the specified DrmStore.Action. The only supported actions are DrmStore.Action.DEFAULT and DrmStore.Action.PLAY. This is an asynchronous task. However, the underlying code is synchronous. It's unclear if other DRM clients will also perform a refresh of the rights from the server. As such, the plugin interface is designed with the expectation that it might, hence the AsyncTask. Widevine documentation still indicates that a refresh from the server occurs. However, the change log says otherwise. After executing the task you can immediately call get() and not block. The result is one of: DrmStore.RightsStatus.RIGHTS_EXPIRED DrmStore.RightsStatus.RIGHTS_INVALID DrmStore.RightsStatus.RIGHTS_NOT_ACQUIRED DrmStore.RightsStatus.RIGHTS_VALID Example usage 
     Source source = new Source("http://example.com/vidoe.wvm");
 AsyncTask<Source, Void, Integer> task = new CheckRightsStatusTask(mDrmManagerClient);
 Integer result = task.execute(source).get();
 
 
     Source source = new Source("http://example.com/vidoe.wvm");
 AsyncTask<Source, Void, Integer> task = new CheckRightsStatusTask(mDrmManagerClient, DrmStore.Action.PLAY);
 Integer result = task.execute(source).get();
